56 /**********************************************************************************
57  * Standard Endianess Macros:
58  * - The HSI Header Protocol works natively over Little Endian. Use the following
59  * macros to ensure portability.
60  **********************************************************************************/
61 #if defined(_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
62 
66 #define HSIHeader_htons(a) (a)
67 
71 #define HSIHeader_htonl(a) (a)
72 
76 #define HSIHeader_htonll(a) (a)
77 
81 #define HSIHeader_ntohl(a) (a)
82 
86 #define HSIHeader_ntohs(a) (a)
87 
91 #define HSIHeader_ntohll(a) (a)
92 
93 #elif defined(_BIG_ENDIAN)
94 
98 #define HSIHeader_htons(a) ((((a)>>8)&0x00FF) + (((a)<<8)&0xFF00))
99 
103 #define HSIHeader_htonl(a) ((((a)>>24)& 0x000000FF) + (((a)>>8) & 0x0000FF00) + \
104  (((a)<<8) & 0x00FF0000) + (((a)<<24)& 0xFF000000))
105 
109 #define HSIHeader_htonll(a) ((((a)>>56)& 0x00000000000000FF) + (((a)>>40)& 0x000000000000FF00) + \
110  (((a)>>24)& 0x0000000000FF0000) + (((a)>>8) & 0x00000000FF000000) + \
111  (((a)<<8) & 0x000000FF00000000) + (((a)<<24)& 0x0000FF0000000000) + \
112  (((a)<<40)& 0x00FF000000000000) + (((a)<<56)& 0xFF00000000000000))
113 
117 #define HSIHeader_ntohll(a) HSIHeader_htonll(a)
118 
122 #define HSIHeader_ntohl(a) HSIHeader_htonl(a)
123 
127 #define HSIHeader_ntohs(a) HSIHeader_htons(a)
128 
129 #else
130 #error "Please define the Endianess (_BIG_ENDIAN) or (_LITTLE_ENDIAN)"
131 #endif

590 typedef struct HSIHeader_t
591 {
596  HSIDataCardHeader dataCardHeader;
597 
601  HSISDKHeader sdkHeader;
602 
606  uint8_t paddingBuffer[HSI_DATA_CARD_ALIGNMENT -
607  sizeof(HSIDataCardHeader) -
608  sizeof(HSISDKHeader)];
609 }HSIHeader;

611 /***********************************************************************************
612  * Exported Protocol Inline Functions:
613  ***********************************************************************************/
614 
629 static inline uint16_t HSIHeader_toBytes (uint16_t cbuffUnits)
630 {
631  return (cbuffUnits << 1U);
632 }
633 
648 static inline uint16_t HSIHeader_toCBUFFUnits (uint16_t bytes)
649 {
650  return (bytes >> 1U);
651 }
652 
667 static inline uint8_t* HSIHeader_getPayload (HSIHeader* ptrHeader)
668 {
669  /* Convert the header size into bytes. Skip the header to get the payload */
670  return (uint8_t*)ptrHeader + HSIHeader_toBytes(ptrHeader->sdkHeader.headerSize);
671 }
672 
689 static inline uint16_t HSIHeader_getHeaderSize (HSIHeader* ptrHeader)
690 {
691  return ptrHeader->sdkHeader.headerSize;
692 }
693 
707 static inline uint16_t HSIHeader_getPaddingSize (HSIHeader* ptrHeader)
708 {
709  uint16_t minHeaderSize;
710 
711  /* Mandatory Size of the Header: Size of the header without any padding. */
712  minHeaderSize = sizeof (HSIDataCardHeader) + sizeof(HSISDKHeader);
713  minHeaderSize = HSIHeader_toCBUFFUnits (minHeaderSize);
714 
715  /* What ever is left after the mandatory header is the padding */
716  return (ptrHeader->sdkHeader.headerSize - minHeaderSize);
717 }
718 
741 static inline void HSIHeader_getVersion
742 (
743  HSIHeader* ptrHeader,
744  uint8_t* major,
745  uint8_t* minor,
746  uint8_t* bugFix,
747  uint8_t* build
748 )
749 {
750  uint16_t version = HSIHeader_htons (ptrHeader->sdkHeader.version);
751 
752  *major = (version & 0xE00) >> 9;
753  *minor = (version & 0x1C0) >> 6;
754  *bugFix = (version & 0x031) >> 3;
755  *build = (version & 0x7);
756 }
757 
773 static inline uint32_t HSIHeader_getTotalLength (HSIHeader* ptrHeader)
774 {
775  uint32_t totalLength;
776 
777  totalLength = sizeof(HSIDataCardHeader);
778  totalLength += (((HSIHeader_htons(ptrHeader->dataCardHeader.totalLengthMSW) & 0xFFF) << 12U) |
779  (HSIHeader_htons(ptrHeader->dataCardHeader.totalLengthLSW) & 0xFFF));
780  return totalLength;
781 }

Definition: hsiprotocol.h:458
HSI_HEADER_MAX_CQ
#define HSI_HEADER_MAX_CQ
This is the maximum number of chirp quality which can be supported in the HSI Header. This should be the same as the definition supported in the ADCBUF Driver. However we cannot use the same macro here because it will make the file dependent on the mmWave SDK. So instead we redefine the macro and verify the sanity during the HSI Header initialization.
Definition: hsiprotocol.h:371

#define HSI_HEADER_MAX_APP_HDR_SIZE

HSI_HEADER_MAX_USER_BUFFER
#define HSI_HEADER_MAX_USER_BUFFER
This is the maximum number of user buffers which can be supported in the HSI Header. This should be the same as the MAX number of user buffers supported in the CBUFF Driver. However we cannot use the same macro here because it will make the file dependent on the mmWave SDK. So instead we redefine the macro and verify the sanity during the HSI Header initialization.
